doc.repnme: Transcript of oral history interview with Harold Graves, Jr. held on July 17, 1985
doc.abstracts: In July 17, 1985, Harold Graves, Jr. was interviewed on behalf of the World Bank Group Archives oral history program by Robert W. Oliver. During his tenure at the Bank from 1950 to 1975, Mr. Graves worked in the following areas: in the information and public affairs department as director (1950-1967); in the International Finance Corporation (IFC) as director of information (1961-1967); as associate director in the development services department (1967-1973) and in the international relations department (1973); in the Consultative Group for International Agricultural Research (CGIAR) as executive secretary (1973-1974) and advisor (1974-1975). His transcript concerns the development of the World Bank during the presidency of George Woods and the transition into the presidency of Robert McNamara.
